data.text:
This character history is on Bradley Raines.

- Former jobs: Spaulding Enterprises Special Security Officer, Cedars hospital security guard, and Spaulding Enterprises security guard.

- Divorced from Lillian Raines

- Died in the summer of 2001, resided in Colorado at the time of his death.

- Played by one actor.

Creepy, villainous quote of the century:

Bradley at his trial in late February 1984. Under cross examination by Ross Marler, Bradley is testifying as to his reason for raping his teenage stepdaughter, Beth:

"No one could love Beth, like I did ... That's why I had to mark her. I had to make sure no one else would ever want her."

Actor/Dates:

- James Rebhorn: May 1983 to Spring 1985; recurring, September 20th, 1989, October 6th, 1989, October 9th to 11th, 1989, October 13th, 1989, December 7th, 1989, January 2nd to 5th, 1990, January 10th, 1990, January 12th & 13th, 1990

Major Events:

- Arrived in Springfield in 1983 with Lillian and Beth

- Had a violent temper and often beat Lillian and Beth

- Threw Beth down a flight of stairs

- Learned Philip Spaulding was not Alan’s biological son

- Anonymously blackmailed Alan for $ 100,000 with Philip’s paternity

- Planned to continue extorting money from Alan but told Philip in a jealous rage when he found out he was in love with Beth

- Falsely accused Phillip Spaulding of raping Beth

- Pulled a gun on Phillip, at Cedars, while he was working as a security guard.

- Pulled a gun on and raped Beth

- Beth moved out to get away from him and he got a court order to force her to come home

- Saved by Phillip and Beth during a struggle with them in New York when he almost fell off a cliff

- Arrested for raping Beth and at his trial pathetically confessed that he had to “mark" Beth so that no one would want her

- Lillian divorced him after the trial and he was remanded to a psychiatrist hospital.

- Met Lujack (Beth’s new love) in prison in 1985 (Lujack was falsely accused of murdering Andy Ferris)

- Lillian asked Bradley to help Lujack

- Lujack escaped, with Beth’s help, during a benefit show where he was singing but Bradley stopped them and demanded Beth’s forgiveness for what he had done to her

- Beth forgave him and he let them escape, that was Bradley’s last appearance until 1989

- In 1989 Dana Jones’ lover visited him in prison and told him Beth (who was presumed dead) was still alive

- Gave Dana’s lover details of Beth’s life, and Dana’s lover told Phillip that he had kidnapped Beth and wanted $ 1 Million

- He was released from prison and discovered Dana’s lover as a swindler and was knocked out by him when he tried to confront him

- Bradley was shortly suspected as the swindler’s accomplice

- Attacked by Beth with a shovel because she thought he was her kidnapper, Professor Blackburn.

- Landing in the hospital after the attack, he told Lillian and Phillip that Beth was actually alive

- After Beth turned up alive, Bradley helped her to regain her memory

- When Beth had fully recovered, Bradley left Springfield for good. Twelve years later, Beth would learn that he was dead and had left her a valuable silver mine in his will.

Information about Bradley Raines was obtained here. Pictures are linked to their sources.
